data.event: Anton was founded in 1924 near the center of the north pasture of the former Spade Ranch when ranch owner William Leonard Ellwood contracted with the Anton Townsite Company to plat a town at the site of Danforth Switch, a spur of the Pecos and Northern Texas Railway.
Anton's first mayor was Paul Grover Whitfield, who was born in July of 1908 so in 1924 was only 16 or 17 years old, but told everyone he was 18 and so was able to accept the position.
